summary:
The Security Council,
 
Recalling its resolution 1545 (2004) and the statement of its President dated 15 August 2004, 
Reaffirming its commitment to Burundi's sovereignty, independence, territorial integrity and unity, 
Reaffirming its support for the Arusha Peace and Reconciliation Agreement, 
Welcoming positive achievements made by Burundian parties, 
Encouraging dialogue and compromise, 
Recalling the importance of holding elections, 
Condemning violence and human rights violations, 
 Reiterating condemnation of the Gatumba massacre, 

Decides to extend the mandate of ONUB until 1 June 2005; 
Urges governments and parties to denounce violence and cooperate with ONUB and MONUC; 
Calls on governments to cooperate to ensure investigation into Gatumba massacre; 
Requests ONUB and MONUC to assist Burundian and Congolese authorities; 
Expresses intention to consider measures against individuals threatening peace and national reconciliation.
The Security Council:
 
6. Requests the Secretary-General to keep it informed on a regular basis of developments in the situation in Burundi, the implementation of the Arusha Agreement, the execution of ONUB’s mandate and the action taken by the Burundian authorities following the Council’s recommendations in the fight against impunity, and to submit a report on these developments every three months;
 
7. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
